plants.title: Snake Plant
plants.subtitle: Sansevieria trifasciata
plants.description: Upright, sword-shaped leaves, air-purifying.
plants.water: Low to moderate, allow soil to dry completely.
plants.sun: Low to medium, tolerates low light.
plants.tips: Wipe leaves occasionally, avoid overwatering.

plants.title: Pothos
plants.subtitle: Epipremnum aureum
plants.description: Heart-shaped leaves, trailing vine, easy to grow.
plants.sun: Low to medium, tolerates low light.
plants.tips: Prune regularly, can be propagated from cuttings.

plants.title: Peace Lily
plants.subtitle: Spathiphyllum wallisii
plants.description: Glossy leaves, white flowers, air-purifying.
plants.water: Moderate, keep soil moist but not soggy.
plants.sun: Low to medium, avoid direct sunlight.
plants.tips: High humidity beneficial, mist leaves regularly.

plants.title: ZZ Plant
plants.subtitle: Zamioculcas zamiifolia
plants.description: Glossy, dark green leaves, very tolerant.
plants.sun: Low to medium, tolerates low light.
plants.tips: Avoid overwatering, slow grower.

plants.title: African Violet
plants.subtitle: Saintpaulia ionantha
plants.description: Velvety leaves, colorful flowers.
plants.water: Moderate, avoid getting water on leaves.
plants.sun: Bright, indirect light, avoid direct sunlight.
plants.tips: Use lukewarm water, remove spent flowers.

plants.title: Orchid
plants.subtitle: Orchidaceae
plants.description: Diverse variety of shapes and colors, elegant blooms.
plants.water: Moderate, depends on specific orchid type.
plants.sun: Bright, indirect light, avoid direct sunlight.
plants.tips: Special orchid potting mix, high humidity beneficial.

plants.title: Lavender
plants.subtitle: Lavandula
plants.description: Aromatic, purple flowers, attracts pollinators.
plants.water: Moderate, allow soil to dry slightly between waterings.
plants.tips: Prune regularly, versatile plant for culinary and medicinal uses.

plants.title: Rosemary
plants.subtitle: Salvia rosmarinus
plants.description: Aromatic, evergreen herb, culinary uses.
plants.tips: Prune to maintain shape, versatile herb.

plants.title: Sunflower
plants.subtitle: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: Tall, bold flowers, attracts birds and bees.
plants.tips: Supports for tall varieties, harvest seeds.

plants.title: Rose
plants.subtitle: Rosa
plants.description: Classic flower, various colors and scents.
plants.tips: Prune regularly, protect from pests and diseases.

plants.title: Venus Flytrap
plants.subtitle: Dionaea muscipula
plants.description: Carnivorous plant, traps insects.
plants.tips: Feed with live insects, avoid fertilizing.

plants.title: Basil
plants.subtitle: Ocimum basilicum
plants.description: Aromatic herb, culinary uses.
plants.tips: Pinch regularly to promote growth.

plants.title: Aloe Vera
plants.subtitle: Aloe barbadensis miller
plants.description: Aloe Vera is a popular succulent known for its medicinal properties. It has thick, fleshy, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges.
plants.tips: Use well-draining soil, like a cactus or succulent mix, and place in a pot with drainage holes to prevent water from sitting in the soil.

plants.title: Jade Plant
plants.subtitle: Crassula ovata
plants.description: The Jade Plant is a popular houseplant with thick, oval-shaped, glossy green leaves. It has a tree-like appearance with a thick, woody stem.
plants.tips: Rotate the plant occasionally to ensure even growth and Prune to maintain shape and remove any leggy growth.

plants.title: Echeveria
plants.subtitle: Echeveria elegans
plants.description: Echeveria is a rosette-forming succulent with fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that come in various colors, including green, blue, pink, and purple.
plants.tips: Remove dead leaves from the base to prevent rot and pests.

plants.title: Haworthia
plants.subtitle: Haworthia fasciata
plants.description: Haworthia, also known as Zebra Plant, is a small, rosette-forming succulent with thick, dark green leaves adorned with white, horizontal stripes.
plants.tips: Avoid overwatering, which can lead to root rot.

plants.title: Sedum
plants.subtitle: Sedum morganianum
plants.description: Sedum, particularly the Burro's Tail variety, is a trailing succulent with long, cascading stems covered in small, plump, blue-green leaves.
plants.water: Moderate, ensure the top inch of soil is completely dry.
plants.tips: Handle with care, as the leaves are delicate and can fall off easily.

plants.title: Mint
plants.subtitle: Mentha
plants.description: Aromatic herb, culinary and medicinal uses.
plants.tips: Can be invasive, plant in containers.

plants.title: Parsley
plants.subtitle: Petroselinum crispum
plants.description: Aromatic herb with finely divided, green leaves. Popular for culinary use.
plants.water: Regular watering, keeping soil consistently moist.
plants.sun: Full sun to partial shade. Tolerates some shade.
plants.tips: Harvest leaves regularly to encourage new growth. Protect from pests like carrot fly.

plants.title: Dill
plants.subtitle: Anethum graveolens
plants.description: Feathery, aromatic leaves and delicate yellow flowers. Used fresh or dried in cooking.
plants.water: Regular watering, especially during hot weather.
plants.sun: Full sun for best flavor and growth.
plants.tips: Sow seeds directly in the garden. Can be self-seeding. Harvest leaves before flowering for optimal flavor.

plants.title: Hosta
plants.subtitle: Hosta spp
plants.description: Hostas are shade-tolerant perennials known for their large, attractive foliage, which can range in color from green to blue to variegated.
plants.water: Moderate, aim for about an inch of water per week.
plants.tips: Mulch around the base to keep soil moist and reduce weeds.

plants.title: Hydrangea
plants.subtitle: Hydrangea spp.
plants.description: Hydrangeas are known for their large, globe-like flower clusters that can be blue, pink, purple, or white.
plants.tips: Prune according to the variety; some bloom on old wood, while others bloom on new wood.
